name: Workflow Dispatch
shortDescription: Intelligent cognitive strategy selection and thinking architecture design

steps.name: Analyze Problem Characteristics - Understand the challenge type
steps.description:
Systematically analyze the problem's fundamental characteristics, complexity, and domain

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Analyze this problem systematically: What type of problem is this? Is it logical, creative, analytical, strategic, or complex/multi-faceted? What domain knowledge is required? What are the key constraints and success criteria? What makes this problem challenging?

steps.name: Research Historical Context & Current Knowledge - Learn from past analyses and fresh insights
steps.description:
Search both memory and online sources for similar problems, successful approaches, and relevant insights. Use search_notes for keyword matches, recent_activity for temporal patterns, build_context for deep relationships, search_related_notes for connected knowledge, and webSearch for current external perspectives.

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

Search both memory and online: What similar problems have been analyzed in our memory system? What approaches worked well previously? What patterns or insights are relevant from past experiences? Then search online for current perspectives, recent developments, and external approaches to similar challenges. Use search_notes to find relevant content, recent_activity to see latest work, build_context to explore relationships, search_related_notes for connected knowledge, and webSearch for fresh external insights. Focus on extracting actionable intelligence from both internal wisdom and external innovation.

steps.name: Assess Cognitive Requirements - Identify thinking needs
steps.description:
Determine what types of cognitive processes and thinking approaches this problem requires

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

What cognitive approaches does this problem need? Does it require: Logical reasoning (deductive/inductive/abductive)? Creative thinking (divergent/lateral/oblique)? Analytical evaluation (critical/convergent)? Strategic analysis? Meta-cognitive reflection? Data-driven analysis? Multiple perspectives? Systematic progression?

steps.name: Select and Execute Workflows - Choose and run complementary workflows
steps.description:
Select complementary workflows for this problem. Use ListMcpResourcesTool to enumerate resource://workflows/ resources and see all available workflows.

üß† ENHANCED THINKING REQUIRED: Use the SequentialThinking tool to work through this systematically.

First, use ListMcpResourcesTool to enumerate resource://workflows/ resources to see all available workflows. Based on the problem characteristics and cognitive requirements, which numbered workflows would be most effective? Select complementary workflows that build on each other. Consider how they work together and in what sequence.

When you've selected the workflows, immediately execute them using the Workflow tool with an array of workflow IDs.

Example: Workflow(["workflow-1", "workflow-2", "workflow-4"])
